headline: Trump issued a new national-security strategy that sharply criticizes the “unrealistic expectations” of European leaders for settling the war in Ukraine and calls for an end to NATO expansion
Two survivors of a Sept. 2 U.S. strike on a boat were killed in follow-up attacks after they were seen still aboard the damaged vessel, a senior commander is expected to tell lawmakers
The Supreme Court allows Texas to use a redrawn congressional map that adds as many as five Republican seats for next year’s midterm elections, boosting GOP chances of retaining control of the House
Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. in an $82.7-billion deal that will transform Hollywood
President Trump honored as ‘very first winner’ of FIFA Peace Prize at World Cup 2026 draw in DC
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth shocked official Washington in mid-October when he said Adm. Alvin Holsey was retiring, but according to two Pentagon officials, Hegseth asked Holsey to step down
Trump to Pardon Juan Orlando Hernández, Honduran Ex-Leader Convicted in Drug Case
Israel’s Latest Military Tech: Tested in Gaza, Wanted by the West
What to Know About Putin’s Visit to India as Oil Trade Dries Up
A federal judge ordered the release of grand-jury transcripts from the Justice Department’s investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in Florida, citing a new law mandating that files be made public
